meanings.definition: To store (green fodder) in a silo for preservation.
meanings.sent1: Farmers ensile fresh grass to keep it fresh for their animals.
meanings.sent2: They ensile the crops every summer to ensure they have enough feed for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The cows were surprised to see the farmers ensile the grass instead of feeding it directly.
meanings.sent4: The silo stood tall, ensiling the harvest like a giant pantry for the farm.
meanings.sent5: Ensiling the hay is like putting it in a time capsule for the livestock.

meanings.sent1: Ensile is an important process in agriculture to preserve animal feed.
meanings.sent2: The ensile of the crops went smoothly this year, ensuring a good supply for the animals.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best ensile in town was fierce among the farmers.
meanings.sent4: The ensile of the harvest symbolized the hard work put into farming throughout the season.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of ensile filled the air, signaling a successful preservation process.
